diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis, Chronic systolic heart failure
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with progressive abdominal pain, diarrhea, anorexia, and increased nausea. A CT scan demonstrated pneumobilia, and the ultrasound findings indicated a significantly distended gallbladder with wall edema and a gallstone lodged in the neck of the gallbladder, supporting the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
